text:
When I grew up,
Chief Customer Officer

was not
on the short list of my ambitions.
Hi, my name is Eric Schreiner.

I'm the Chief
Customer Officer of Spryker,

which is a German-based
e-commerce software platform vendor.

In the subscription economy,
I think it's really important

that customers get
what they were intending for

and what they put their hope in
when they made a purchase decision.

There's a big shift
in the subscription economy

is now that you are renting software,
or you are renting a service,

and I think, in simple terms,
what Spryker is doing with AWS

is comparable with what you,
in your private life,

would do
with any subscription service.

Once a customer
has decided to go with Spryker,

we have a packaged offering,
where Spryker runs on AWS.

We can provide the system
in a very short period of time.
The platform is highly performant.

It's deployable
everywhere in the world.

It's very secure
and gives us the opportunity to cater

for all these demands in a quick
and reliable, secure fashion.

It's great to have the DNA
and the cores in Germany,

but overall, I would say
we've become a truly global company
in the past years.

Speed, time to value
is a massive thing.
Time to innovation is a big thing.

So, running MVPs
and being able to do that,

I think
we've also partnered up very nicely

to get efficiency gains out there,
get cost reductions
for our customers in there.

Future innovation, for me,
looks like something that will happen

much more
on a thought leadership level
than on a technology level.

So, I do think
we are catering for that very well.
It's very hard to foresee the future.

I think we, together with AWS,
are catering for that fact
and to tackle these uncertainties.
